name: Coffee and the Cantonment
description:
This trail traces the evolution of coffee in Bangalore and takes you to legacy coffee joints to understand what makes Bangalore the cradle of coffee culture in India.We will start at Koshy's on St Marks road exploring the neighborhood that houses several important landmarks, the role of British hangover in the city, and the evolution of the coffee culture in Bangalore.

You will hear interesting stories and trivia about coffee and local traditions on this tour.

We will end it at a new-age Coffee shop with one of their signature drinks.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.Bangalore is a cradle of the coffee culture in India. Locals and tourists both swear by it because no day is complete without a cuppa. But how did this African drink become a local favourite? What role did the British play for coffee in Bangalore? What led to the cafe culture in Bangalore? You'll find answers to all these questions on this tour.
 We will explore the history of the Cantonment, how it evolved to support the British establishment in erstwhile India, and how Bangalore went on to become a melting pot of cultures. As we do this, we will look at the evolution of coffee in the city from traditional coffee houses to new age micro-roasters catering to the needs of the ever changing city, and explore neighbourhoods that still hold stories of the British Raj.
 This tour is the perfect coffee date with the city and a must-do if you're in Bangalore or visiting.

name: Death by Dosa
description:
History and food walk in the oldest neighbourhood of Bangalore, we have 3 dosa stops and 3 non food stopsYou should do this trial becauseWe will start on Avenue Road with a cup of coffee from a unique coffee truck, walk through tiny alleys of erstwhile Pete that power industries from jewellery to food to textiles.

We’ll visit discover what stories the 150-year-old majestic structure hides and find our way back to Avenue Road where we end the walk.

Whether you have lived in Bangalore all your life or you are new to the city, we would love to host you at our secret Dosa spots and explore the streets more. Do come with an appetite as you may want to cancel your lunch plans after this gastronomic affair in the bylanes of Chickpete.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.Death by Dosa is a food + history walk in the oldest neighbourhood of Bangalore, Chickpete.

Everyone in Bengaluru swear by dosas and each has their own favourite joint. On this walk we’ll take you to what we believe are some of the finest dosa joints in town that have stood the test of time. You will savour three different kinds of dosas and explore chickpete through its narrow alleyways and learn about the history of the city.

We will meet master saree weavers, learn more about Kempegowda’s grand vision for town planning, and belt some hot, hot masala dosas on the way. We’ll also explore a 150+ yrs old heritage mansion that has stories for almost every decade, filled with characters as well as visit Bangalore's oldest antique shop.
 Whether you are a local or a visitor, our Death by Dosa walk is a great way to explore Bengaluru with a dash of dosa and a dollop of history!

name: Malleshwaram Hogona
description:
This street art walk featuring 13 Indian artists and 12 artworks is an initiative by the Bengaluru Moving Campaign in association with the artist collective Geechugalu and several other partners to make the neighbourhood of Malleshwaram safe and friendly for women mobility. Gully Tours was the official partner to design the walking tour.What makes this tour specialWe’ll start this walk by relishing some legendary dosa at Shri Sagar CTR. From there we’ll visit the conservancy lanes that are adorned with art. We’ll explore the Malleshwaram market, seva sadan, sampige road, and end it at the BMTC bus stand.

Malleswaram is like a warm hug from a handmade shawl on a cold winter day. It’s a modern-day Malgudi with the goodness of history and the excitement of new-age quirks.

Street art captures the stories of people, their lives, and their neighbourhoods. Show some love to your local artists and let us go to Malleswaram.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.13 Indian artists came together to create 12 walls filled with art through the secret lanes of Malleswaram to reclaim spaces for pedestrians and women. The Malleswaram Hogona (Eng: Let’s go to Malleswaram) street art project wants to make streets safer for women. Conceived by the Bengaluru moving project, this street art walk is an initiative to make neighbourhoods safe, friendly, and full of character.

Apart from being one of the oldest planned neighbourhoods in the city, it houses a flower market, many institutions and lanes adorned with trees. Each work of art tells you the artist’s inspiration and their connection to the landscape, and we’d love to host you here.

Let’s go to Malleswaram to witness modern day murals painted on old world lanes, starting with a legendary breakfast at CTR.

name: Cantt by Night
description:
This walk is about different communities that built modern Bangalore. Before the bazaars became popular, Cantonment saw activists, entrepreneurs, and social reformers in the erstwhile British India.What makes this tour specialWe will start the tour at a heritage bungalow and wade through the residential lanes of Shivajinagar, ending it closer to Commercial Street.

We will explore 100 year old structures, visit different small businesses, and learn about the various historical figures that contributed to education, jobs, and opportunities for the people as well as savour the local favourite snacks and food that are distinct to this part of the city.

This walk has been specially curated by a local resident, who grew up in the Commercial Street neighbourhood and has lived its rich history.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.Bangalore’s Cantonment areas are extra special. It’s a melting pot of cultures built together by the locals, immigrants, and the British. In Cantt by night, we will be exploring the lesser-known side of Commercial street, which goes beyond the regular street shopping fare. There are houses, shops, institutions and more that carry the legacy of leaders and prominent names in Bangalore’s history. And of course, no legacy is complete without the presence of food. From a family-run dosa joint to a 48-year-old sweet shop and a legacy bakery, there’s a brilliant food mix on the menu as you explore the ruins and reigns of one of Bangalore’s most popular shopping districts.
